metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4766 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 10, tvOS before 10, iTunes before 12.5.1 onWindows, and Safari before 10 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycode or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted website, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-4759, CVE-2016-4765,CVE-2016-4767, and CVE-2016-4768.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
